subject: Sexual Health
title: Gametes: Eggs and Sperm
description: One-minute skill: Gametes: Eggs and Sperm.

hook.text: A human egg is the largest cell in the body. A sperm is among the smallest. Together they start life.

buildup.text: Eggs carry nutrients and half the DNA. Sperm carry the other half and a tail built for swimming.

discovery.text: Gametes are specialized cells with only 23 chromosomes, half the usual 46 found in human cells.

twist.text: A woman is born with all her eggs already formed. Men produce fresh sperm continuously through life.

climax.text: When egg and sperm unite, their half-sets combine into a complete new human genome of 46 chromosomes.

punchline.text: Two half-cells merge into one whole new person.

quiz.question: How many chromosomes do human gametes contain?
